intro: Labordia fagraeoidea var. hillebrandii, commonly known as the Hillebrand's labordia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
